posts.post_content: Does this require that the protected creatures need to be "target"s to be protected as in a spell that destroys all creatures, will still destroy your creatures. Is Infect an ability that targets a creature. I guess I have a lot of questions on this card and I want to be sure of them. It just seems to me that the wording of the card is specific in that there can still be effects or spells that will effect said creatures.

posts.post_content:
This *would* be great, but WoTC emphasized artifact/enchantment hate this set, and frankly, people are still running a lot in sideboards &/or main deck, [Nature's Claim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nature's Claim) is epic in Infect decks for example.  
If I had a slot open, and I was thinking, "Gee, maybe I need to play a defensive spell in my aggro deck" Then I'd play it. As things stand, Day of Judgment is still out there, & All is Dust is being played even more. Being able to regenerate my dudes is great, but it's at cost, & in the deck this wants played in, I wanted to use that mana for more aggro, draw or control. Not only that, but this hits the board a few turns too late, unless I'm elf ramping it out (Hint Hint, It's great with elves).  
Don't mistake what I'm saying for me hating this card, on the contrary, it's won me a few games at fnm, but it's also been a dead card in my hand a LOT, because my decks just don't want to use mana for that effect most of the time. I'm still thinking about puttin... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

As things stand, Day of Judgment is still out there, & All is Dust is being played even more. Being able to regenerate my dudes is great, but it's at cost, & in the deck this wants played in, I wanted to use that mana for more aggro, draw or control. Not only that, but this hits the board a few turns too late, unless I'm elf ramping it out (Hint Hint, It's great with elves).
Don't mistake what I'm saying for me hating this card, on the contrary, it's won me a few games at fnm, but it's also been a dead card in my hand a LOT, because my decks just don't want to use mana for that effect most of the time. I'm still thinking about puttin... (see all)
